intro: Sida fibulifera, commonly known as the slender sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pink flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its fibrous stems and leaves have been used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Sida fibulifera is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both full sun and partial shade.
